Authors: Suroso J.S., Tarigan R.E., Setyawan F.B.
Title: Information systems strategic planning: Using design thinking method at startup company
Source title: Proceedings of the 2017 4th International Conference on Computer Applications and Information Processing Technology, CAIPT 2017
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebun Jerk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suroso, J.S., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebun Jerk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia; Tarigan, R.E., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebun Jerk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia; Setyawan, F.B., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebun Jerk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Like other industries, logistic services especially for inner city deliveries currently also facing immense changes due digital disruption. Although many logistics companies use information technology in their business models, but not all of them make information technology as their core business. With the new technology developments, new competitor, new business model and changing customer behavior, the company should also change to optimize technology support. Therefore, this startup company for logistic and especially in last mile deliveries will make an information systems to support their business by using Design Thinking (DT) approach as Information System Strategic Planning (ISSP). With Design Thinking and Personas approach, hopefully able to create a system with good user experiences and user satisfaction while using the product. The result is defined proper business flow and developing website and android applications to facilitate business activities. The conclusion of this research is Design thinking is one of alternative method that can be used to make strategic planning of information system for company, either new company (start-up) or corporate. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Design Thinking; Logistic; Start-u; Strategic Planning of Information Systems
Index Keywords: Customer satisfaction; Information systems; Logistics; Product design; Strategic planning; Android applications; Business activities; Design thinking; Logistics company; New business models; New technology development; Start-up companies; Technology support; Information use

Authors: Sfenrianto, Gunawan W., Kelly D.S., Tarigan R.E.
Title: The use of quality, security and trust factors to improve the online purchase decision
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sfenrianto, Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Gunawan, W., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Kelly, D.S., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Tarigan, R.E., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Apparel industry is one of the largest business that serves online customers around the world. Indonesia as a country with the huge apparel industries enjoys the growth of online business. With the consistent growth of middle class economy, apparel industry has become the most promising online business in Indonesia. Due to its huge supplies and demands, have created complex business environment for apparel industry in Indonesia. It combines with online issues such as we b quality, security and trust, are the main issues haunting major Indonesian customers, which are developing their knowledge about online business. The paper uses a case study of the largest online apparel vendor in the South-East Asia, Zalora, where it has strong customer bases in greater Jakarta area. The paper examines the important factors of website quality, security and trust and relates them to the purchasing decision. © 2005 – ongoing JATIT & LLS.
Author Keywords: e-Commerce; Online purchase decision; Security; Trust; Website quality

Title: Factors affecting procrastination in the virtual teams: An experimental research approach based on the theory of planned behavior
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 4th International Conference on New Media Studies, CONMEDIA 2017
Affiliations: Department of Information System, Pelita Harapan University, Tangerang, Indonesia; Graduate Program of Management Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Widjaja, A.E., Department of Information System, Pelita Harapan University, Tangerang, Indonesia; Tarigan, R.E., Graduate Program of Management Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Procrastination is a common phenomenon which can be experienced by both the individuals and the teams. Yet, by referring to the current literature, little is known concerning the procrastination behaviors within the context of the virtual teams. Drawing from the theory of planned behavior, this present paper will propose and discuss an experimental research approach to specifically investigate the procrastination within the context of the virtual teams. The nature of this paper is research or work in progress. The relevant and related theory, concepts, prior works, hypotheses, and the experimental research designs will be discussed in this paper. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: experimental design; procrastination; theory of planned behavior; virtual teams
Index Keywords: Experimental research; Is researches; procrastination; Theory of Planned Behavior; Virtual team; Work in progress; Design of experiments

Authors: Adrian D., Prabowo H., Gaol F.L., Tarigan R.E.
Title: Revenue, market segmentation and categories of mobile applications that affect an investor's venture capital decision in mobile business applications
Affiliations: Master of Information System, Faculty of Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrian, D., Master of Information System, Faculty of Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Prabowo, H., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Tarigan, R.E., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: The development of mobile applications has mushroomed base in both the local and foreign industry. This provides a tremendous opportunity for developers. For Technopreneur as developer, including the capital to run the business into a problem that is often experienced even though they have great competence. Whereas the market share in Indonesia is very large so much to invite investors from both local and overseas to invest as venture capital. However, due to lack of knowledge about how to work together with the investors and do not know how to give the desired value and the investor market for long-term sustainable, making the developer becomes difficult to grow its business and compete with competitors. This research will seek to influence the selection of the level of revenue and market segmentation to support investment decisions in the business of mobile applications, so that the mobile application developer is able to monetize their business to attract investors to invest in venture capital. © 2014 International Information Institute.
Author Keywords: Investment Decisions; Market Segmentation; Mobile Applications; Revenue Levels; Venture Capital
